content:
Oh, damn.
I lost another file.

Hey, Dwight,
do you want an Altoid?

In school, we learned
about this scientist

who trained dogs to salivate
at the sound of a bell

by feeding them
whenever a bell rang.

So,
for the past couple weeks,

I've been conducting
a similar experiment.

My mouth tastes
so bad all of a sudden.

Actually, let's bring Mom
back in and the sisters
and you and you and you.
MICHAEL: Phyllis is getting married and I am in the wedding party.

She has asked me
to push her father's
wheelchair down the aisle.

So, basically, I am
co-giving away the bride.
it is like I'm paying for the wedding, which I'm happy to do.
It's a big day for Phyllis,

but it's an even
bigger day for me.

Yes.
I put Michael in my wedding.

It was the only way
I could think to get

six weeks off
for my honeymoon.

No one else
has ever gotten
six weeks before.

Phyllis ended up
using the exact same
invitations as Roy and me.

So, it was kind of
like being invited
to my own wedding.
And I was like, "Wait, I thought I called that off?"

So, what's in the box?
A toaster.

You look as beautiful
as the Queen of England.

We usually marry
standing in our own graves.

It makes the funerals
very romantic,

but the weddings
are a bleak affair.

JIM: Those flowers are nice.
KAREN: Yeah.

I swear, Phyllis,
you are as beautiful

as the first day
you started work
at Dunder Mifflin.

Same as when you
said it outside.

How you doing?
Are you excited?

If you need to vomit,
that is okay. I did.

Do you want to
talk about tonight?

Because
I know you're probably
worried about pleasing Bob.

It's okay if you did,
it's a very natural reaction.

It's your wedding,
and you're nervous...
I lost my train of thought.

Are you set on
that hairstyle?

I thought it was...
Michael, no...
Here, let me.

I don't need your help.
Thank you, no.

Just cover up
that bald patch.

Michael, please.
I just need some time alone.

You might be
surprised to learn that

I've only been to
one other wedding.

It's actually
a very cute story.
My mom was marrying Jeff, and they asked me to be ring bearer.
A long story short, Jeff's dog ended up as ring bearer.
And the irony is that, after the ceremony

Why are all these
people here?

There's too many
people on this Earth.

I bet a lot of them
are wedding crashers.

No way.
Did you ever see that movie?
I bought a ticket for Grizzly Man

and went into
the wrong theater.

After an hour,
I figured I was
in the wrong theater,

Because that's
the thing about
bear attacks,

they come when
you least expect it.

I wish I had
the investigative powers

to actually smoke some of
these guys out, you know?

Once again, Jim,
I will take care of this.

I will locate
the wedding crashers
and report them to Phyllis.

That way I won't
have to get her a gift.

Could you scoot over?
You're on my dress.

I thought you're not supposed
to wear white to a wedding.

I know,
but there was an emergency.

I look really good
in white.

This strapping,
young lad sitting here
is Phyllis' father, Elbert,

and he is quite
the ladies' man.

I will do better.
I am going to be better.

I can't believe
I'm actually doing this.

Are you ready for this,
Elbert? I am.

Me walking
Phyllis down the aisle

was supposed to be
the highlight of the wedding.

And now,
the wedding has no highlight.

I can't believe I pushed
that guy's lazy ass
around all day

until he was
ready to stand up
and steal the show.

And do you, Phyllis,
take Bob Vance,
Vance Refrigeration,

to be your
lawfully wedded husband?

Ladies and gentlemen,
may I present to you,
for the first time as a couple, Mr. And Mrs. Bob Vance!

And do you, Bob,
take Phyllis to be
your lawfully wedded wife?
You may now kiss the bride.
for the first time as a couple, Mr. And Mrs. Bob Vance!

It's so white,
my eyes are burning.

Congratulations, Bob.
You're a good man.

if you ever lay a finger
on Phyllis, I will kill you.

If you ever lay a finger
on Phyllis, I'll kill you.

Agreed. No fingers
will be laid on Phyllis.

Oh, decided to
sit down again, huh?

Great.
Bet you can hear me, too?

Also, I'm gonna need to see
a copy of the guest manifest

as well as
photographs of the caterers.

This must be
so awful for you.

Well, this is supposed
to be your wedding.

There's no way it's fine.
I'm sorry.

If I was you,
I would just, like,

freak out and
get really drunk

and then tell
someone I was pregnant.

Okay. That's a lot
of good ideas. Thanks.

Excuse me, sir,
how do you know
the happy couple?

The bride and groom.
What are their names?
I get it. I get it.

Come on, freeloader.
Let's move it.

Okay, okay.
Where are we going?

You've got to find yourself
another wedding to crash,
my friend.

Phyllis? Are you
happy with everything?

What can I do to
make it more perfecter?

Why don't you find your seat
and enjoy the buffet.

I'm already on it.
The chicken?

Totally undercooked.
I sent it back.
I will take care of that.

I do. I know a fair amount
about fine food and drink.

No, this is not
our first wedding.

This is the third wedding
that Scrantonicity
has played.

We also played
our bassist's wedding
and our guitarist's wedding.
I'm supposed to ask if anyone has seen Uncle Al.
He is old and has brown eyes and dementia.
You don't have to put on your red light

I know I don't normally
notice these kind of things,

I mean,
the flowers and stuff.

Phyllis has got
some great taste.

I know you probably aren't
gonna remember this, but,

I got you those
color roses for our prom.

Phyllis just stole all of
my ideas for our wedding.

I guess
I wasn't really too
involved in the planning.

Well, you think
it sucks for you?

I'm the one who actually
wanted to get married.

Thank you, Randy.
That was great. Thank you.
I am going to be your tour guide through
the lives of Phyllis Lapin and Bob Vance,
one of the great, seemingly impossible, love stories of our time.
as "the fusing of two metals with a hot torch."
For those of you who don't know me,

The most important part of
a speech is the opening line.

When time is not a factor,
I like to try out three or
four different ones.
Phyllis and Bob, their celebrity couple name would be
You look at her, and she's kind of matronly today,
but back in high school, I swear her nickname was Easy Rider.
Okay, that's enough. Thanks. ... is a guy...

Thanks, Michael.
Give me the mike.

He works...
Okay, hold on, hold on...

I didn't say anything
when Phyllis's dad
upstaged me at the ceremony.

And I think you
owe me this, okay?

It's okay.
You're out of here.
Okay, good.

Yeah, you're out of here.
You're...
A year has passed since I wrote my note

When are we gonna get to
see some of those famous
Beesly dance moves?

Get out there.
Give the people
what they want.
No. I'm such a dorky dancer.

I know.
And it's very cute.

Hypothetically,
if I thought Pam
was interested, then,

Come on.
I can't let you in, Michael.

Dwight, just...
No. It's Bob and
Phyllis's orders.

Look, I just wanted to
go in and quietly sit,
and have a piece of cake.

I'm not even gonna dance,
one song, maybe...

You are a real
life wedding crasher
and I must bounce you.

I'm sorry,
it gives me no pleasure.
You remember me when the west wind moves
You'll forget the sun in his jealous way
As we walk in fields of gold

I thought they only
played The Police.

Hey, you wanna
get out of here?

I'm really happy
I'm with Karen.
Now I know my love for her goes on

I just want Phyllis
to have a great day.

Phyllis and you
will be great together.

We are great together.
We are a great team.

The Celtics
were a great team.

I should talk to her.
I don't want this to
ruin her honeymoon.

Well, nobody ever helped me.
I had to do it myself.

I listened to you
for a half an hour

even though
most of that stuff
went right over my head.

I just wanted to make
this a day to remember.

Yeah, yeah.
He's kind of a weirdo.
MICHAEL: They say that your wedding day goes by in such a flash
that you're lucky if you even get a piece of your own cake.
